alert.note: Alert for Richland (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:03AM CDT until May 03 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Pembina, Kittson, Marshall and Walsh Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Polk, Grand Forks, Marshall and Walsh Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Clay and Cass Counties. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Traill and Norman Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 10.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
